sourcing.instructions:
Co: Purchase from a chemical supply company or online supplier specializing in metals. 
 Eu: Obtain from rare earth element suppliers or specialty chemical providers. 
 Ni: Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers. 
 P: Obtain from a chemical supplier or fertilizer store (as phosphorous).
steps: Co: Purchase from a chemical supply company or online supplier specializing in metals.
Eu: Obtain from rare earth element suppliers or specialty chemical providers.
Ni: Available at hardware stores or metal suppliers.
P: Obtain from a chemical supplier or fertilizer store (as phosphorous).
1. Measure out 11.7 g of cobalt (Co).
2. Measure out 23.4 g of europium (Eu).
3. Measure out 5.85 g of nickel (Ni).
4. Measure out 46.8 g of phosphorus (P).
5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry mixing container.
6. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until it becomes a fine powder, ensuring even distribution of the elements.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 11.7 g of cobalt (Co). 
 2. Measure out 23.4 g of europium (Eu). 
 3. Measure out 5.85 g of nickel (Ni). 
 4. Measure out 46.8 g of phosphorus (P). 
 5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 
 6. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until it becomes a fine powder, ensuring even distribution of the elements.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible.
2. Place the crucible in a furnace.
3. Heat gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C/min.
4. Hold the temperature at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.
heating.raw_text:
1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 
 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 
 3. Heat gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C/min. 
 4. Hold the temperature at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification of the material.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours).
2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to avoid thermal shock to the crucible.
cooling.raw_text:
1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 
 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to avoid thermal shock to the crucible.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid material from the crucible.
2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections.
3. Use sandpaper or a grinding tool to smooth out the surface as needed.
4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid material from the crucible. 
 2. Inspect for any rough edges or imperfections. 
 3. Use sandpaper or a grinding tool to smooth out the surface as needed. 
 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation if necessary.
